author: Staff Reporter
text:
As many as 2,795 persons have utilised the service of nine Voter Facilitation Centre (VFC) established in all the six Assembly Constituencies in the district.

District Election Officer and Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy inspected the centres functioning in Revenue Divisional Officer and Tahsildar office here.

Addressing the reporters, he said that to ensure 100 per cent polling, various awareness programmes are being held for the electors. The VFCs enable electors to know whether their name is in the electoral roll or not and if not forms are available in the centre for enrolment.

Also, forms for name inclusion, deletion, correction and forms for getting colourful EPIC cards are also available at the centre.

He said that 294 persons had approached the centres to check whether their name is in the electoral roll, 295 persons sought their EPIC card number, 636 submitted Form 6 for name inclusion, two submitted Form 7 for deletion, 200 persons submitted Form 8 for correction, 60 persons submitted Form 8A for change of address, and 1,309 persons sought duplicate EPIC card by submitting Form 001.

A total of 2,795 persons utilised the service of these centres in all the constituencies. Hence, he called upon more electors to utilise the service and ensure that they cast their vote without fail.

Returning Officer for Namakkal Assembly constituency and Revenue Divisional Officer M. Kannan, Tahsildar Subramaniyam, Namakkal Municipal Commissioner Senthil Murugan and others were present during the inspection.
title: Over 2,790 people benefitted through voter facilitation centre
